title: As hurricane season begins, Edisto Beach reminded of past storm damage 19 hours ago
content: Edisto Beach drone image after Irma (WCIV).png    Edisto Island, S.C. (WCIV) —    Ellen Taylor has lived in Edisto since 1970, but she says the last two hurricane seasons have been among the hardest.    "We lost so much," Taylor said. "We had to crawl in the windows because the flood was so high."    Many full time Edisto Beach residents expressed frustration at not being allowed back to their homes for three days following Hurricane Matthew in 2016.    "People that lived in Charleston County and unincorporated Colleton County felt free to come back in," said Edisto Beach Mayor Jane Darby. "There’s no resources, there was nothing."    Mayor Darby says the evacuation and reentry process was smoother after Hurricane Irma in 2017, but she felt like her town was forgotten after Hurricane Matthew.    "The people of this island were neglected," she said. "We have Colleton County at one OPCON level, and Charleston at another, that confuses and nobody knows what they’re supposed to do."    She said counties at different levels of hurricane readiness impacted available resources, but she's not shifting blame.    "Part of that’s my fault," she said. "For not emphasizing what was needed. It came but it was greatly delayed…which I think was a problem."    This year, leaders with the Town of Edisto have a mutual aid agreement in place with Charleston County ahead of the 2018 hurricane season.     "We’re going to help each other out. If I call and ask if he’s got the resources to send, he’s going to, and mutually," said Edisto Police Chief George Brothers, speaking of Charleston County Sheriff Al Cannon.    Chief Brothers told ABC News 4 the mutual aid agreement with Charleston County was not in place following Hurricane Matthew and Irma.    Charleston County still provided aid following those hurricanes.    Mayor Darby said public infrastructure and facilities damage is over $5 million for Edisto Beach from the last two hurricanes.
